goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
indicator_name: Number of deaths, missing persons and directly affected persons attributed to disasters per 100,000 population
goal_name: 1. End poverty in all its forms everywhere
target_name: 1.5: By 2030, build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other economic, social and environmental shocks and disasters
indicator_name1: 1.5.1: Number of deaths attributed to disasters
organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Department of Digital Development and Sustainable Development Statistics)
definitions: Number of deaths attributed to disasters.
concepts: The number of people who died during the disaster, or directly after, as a direct result of the hazardous event
rationale_interpretation: Large-scale catastrophic events characterize data on disaster losses. Reporting of emergencies allows for additional analysis to identify trends and patterns in which such catastrophic events can be prevented, thus contributing to sustainable development and enhancing economic resilience, social, health and environmental issues. Economic, environmental and social perspectives include poverty eradication, urban resilience and climate change adaptation.
data_sources: MESs provides annual summaries submitting the 1-ES Statistical Reporting Form.
data_collection: Businesses and organizations, local government bodies and cities of regional significance submit data to the local State administration and district offices of the Ministry of Emergency Situations, then to regional offices and the city of Bishkek, then finally to the Ministry of Emergency Situations.
quality_assurance: Each death attributed to disasters is confirmed by a special committee certificate.
data_availability_gaps: Data for Kyrgyzstan available since 2007 onwards
disaggregation: National and subnational level by gender.
international_comparability: Data for Kyrgyzstan are comparable with other countries as they are compiled in accordance with international methodology.
